sub_title: Certified Master Life Coach - Helps Women finding the best way of doing business in line with who they are and succeed without endorsing another costume 💫
summary:
UGS COACHING - www.ugscoaching.com
After 6 years of coaching my own international teams during my corporate roles and being certified Master Life Coach, I decided to focus on helping women to find work life balance by providing them the right tools to get the right mindset so that they can enjoy their dream life.
• I help women through life changes and empower them to become their best version (Group coaching, 1:1 coaching)

UPGREEN STORIES - www.upgreenstories.com
After having been certified "Social and Environmental Change Maker" by HEC Paris in 2017, I launched Upgreen Stories.
• I help Upcyclers increase their business and live from their Passion (coaching and marketplace to support the digitalization of their offer)
• I help in decreasing the waste creation by providing an European Marketplace proposing ALL kind of upcycled products and services at ONE SINGLE place

PI:
- Results oriented according to the targets
- Details oriented for the realization of projects
- Can deal with pressure and stress: reactive, deadline keeper
- Good communicator, interpersonal and influencing skills
- Problem-solver
- Objective, open-minded, used to work within a multi-cultural environment
- Initiative taker
- Creative/out-of-the-box thinker
- Fast and efficient: Sprinter
- More a Leader than a Manager

Results of my 16 Personalities test: ENFJ (Protagonist personality)
- Extraverted: 86%
- Assertive: 76%
- Feeling: 74%
- Prospecting: 63%
- Intuitive: 53%

profile_positions.description:
Conventional methods:

✔️  Master Life Coach
✔️  Business coach
✔️  Hypnosis Master Practitioner

  
💫 Empower Women to find work life balance and enjoy their dream life, in every life areas
💫 Co-create ambitious businesses to contribute to social and environmental positive impact

Specialized in helping you finding your life purpose within 3 to 6 months.

3 pillars:
- Mindset
- Goals settings
- Self development

Contact me: ugscoaching@gmail.com
Coaching: individual and group

🎙 Podcast host of “Les Perles de Jade”

profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
• Role called “Senior Commercial Manager” within Princes BV, I was Responsible of the European Buying Department - Team of 4 Direct Reports and for the following products categories:

- Tuna and other fishes (Mackerel, Anchovies, Sardines, Salmon, Herring, Codliver)
- Italian Products (Tomato, Pulses, Pasta)
- Dairy Products (Milk Powder, Butter, Cheese)
- Fruits (Pineapple, Mango)

Main Responsibilities for Princes brand and Customer Own Brand:
• Suppliers (relationship) management
• Sourcing
• NPD management
• Europe buying strategy creation and implementation
• Raw material monitoring
• Strategic buying to cover the right period of stock vs market conditions
• Existing process improvement
• New process creation and implementation
• Coordination between the group entities based in UK and Mauritius for any Fish topic
• Being part of the european Steering Innovation Committee

Out of scope:
• European lead for Sustainability
• European lead for Ethical
• Member of the Company’s Events Committee since 2018 (organization of 6 events per year for company’s members)
profile_positions.title: Buying Department Manager - Europe

profile_positions.description:
Scope: Global Traded Goods Category including Premium Tableware category (ceramics, stainless steel, glassware, linen...) and Cardbard/Paper based category (folding board, sugarcane, etc.)

Mission: Responsible and accountable for leading and developing the Traded Goods category globally delivering a competitive global portfolio of manufacturers, suppliers and brands that meet customer needs. Working closely with internal stakeholders to win new business for deSter in airline, foodservice, rail, road through the delivery of best in class sourcing and procurement in line with Total Cost Management principles and practices.

Team: 6 direct reports (1 in The Netherlands, 1 in Belgium, 1 in China, 1 in Hong Kong, 2 in Thailand)

• Define, implement and develop Procurement Global Category strategy
• Manage risks (Market, Geopolitical, Supply): Raw Material fluctuation, costs, security of supply, quality, leadtime
• Manage partnership with key suppliers
• Manage, coach and train a global team of 6 direct reports (category managers/sourcing specialists)
• Participate in innovative and proactive sourcing for Market Intelligence
• Participate in Sustainability projects
• Improve existing/Implement new processes
• Share and implement best practices within the company

Skills: global team coordination, coaching and management ; projects management, NPD and costs management, global suppliers panel/relationship management, best practices sharing, existing tools/process improvement/creation
profile_positions.title: GLOBAL CATEGORY LEAD/MANAGER - Traded Goods

profile_positions.description:
Scope: Packaging, Ingredients, MRO – for the Brussels Factory and the Points of Sales (Retail: 14 owned stores ; Wholesale: 57 franchisees ; GTR EMEA + NA: 676 POS)

Team: 4 direct reports (Category buyers)

• Lead and implement the Global and set the EMEA Procurement Strategies
• Drive synergies within the pladis group (Godiva, United Biscuits, DeMets and Ülker)
• Share and implement best practices
• Drive global level sourcing and select key suppliers
• Negotiate frame agreements
• Manage suppliers relationships with key suppliers
• Manage, coach and develop a team of 4 direct reports

KPI’s: PPV (Purchase Price Variance), productivity projects, adherence to NPD process
profile_positions.title: SOURCING MANAGER EMEA - Directs

profile_positions.description:
Role and Mission:
• Implement global and EMEA (Europe, Middle-East, Africa) procurement strategy at regional level for Retail/Wholesale and  Global Travel Retail EMEA and GTR North-America
• Strategic Sourcing and selection, Smart Spend Management
• Negotiate: contract, SLA, prices
• PPV, Market Risk Management
• Manage Seasonal Collections from idea submission via NPD process to delivery in the warehouse
• Manage Intercompany sourcing: PacRim (Asia not including Japan), North-America and Japan

Packaging Scope: board (rigid, folding, corrugated), flexibles (aluminum, foil), plastic (trays, PET, cello etc.), others (shopping bags, plushes, ribbons, swingtags, giftcards, cups, sleeves, books, scarves, badges, stickers etc.)... + any products made by co-manufacturers.

Out of scope:
- Creation and improvement of (procurement) processes and WoW: RACI, Packaging Brief, RFQ templates
- Coaching of internal stakeholders and newcomers
- Implementation of Sharepoint platform (in progress)
- Management of 1 person from Q1 2016
- Management of Indirect Retail (Marketing/Sales promotional/printed material, pre-press/agency activities) 
- Implementation of e-sourcing for 2016
- Procurement synergies with the other companies from the Pladis group (Godiva, DeMets, Ülker, United Biscuits)
profile_positions.title: SOURCING MANAGER EMEA - Packaging

profile_positions.description:
*Consultant - Project assigned by ALTRAN Belgium*

My mission - responsible for the downstream equipment: chromatography, ultrafiltration, coupling reactors:
• Develop strong interface with engineers to ensure procurement early involvement and total integration in the teams
• Build a transversal view on equipment packages
• Develop Market knowledge, evaluate, identify best practices and promote innovation
• Participate to sourcing plan activities
• Implement global agreement and ensure their communication throughout the organisation
• Work in a matrix organization
• Deal with complex sourcing, logistics and quality issues
• Conduct inquiries and negotiations for global sourcing of packages
• Reduce TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) on equipment’s categories by developing sourcing and optimizing spend
• Align strategic and package execution with PPM (Procurement Project Manager) and ensure smooth and efficient collaboration and communication
• Support SRM (Suppliers Relationship Management) via BRM (Business Review Meetings) 
• Develop with experts new way of working to improve project lead time
• Ensure follow-up and respect of procurement policies and compliance

Out of scope:
Creation of a newcomer guide

Skills: Interpersonal skills, negotiation, organization and analytical skills, multi-tasks, initiative taker, autonomous
profile_positions.title: SOURCING MANAGER - CapEx (Mission assigned by Altran)

profile_positions.description:
*Consultant - Project assigned by ALTRAN Belgium*

Mission:
- Procurement lead on sourcing waves (largest sourcing wave >  EUR 30M Spend)
- RFP management
- Profiles/mission descriptions standardization (80 -> 60) and references rationalization 
- Suppliers mapping / panel rationalization (60 -> 20)
- Suppliers evaluation (based on a weighted scorecard matrix)
- Negotiation (23 suppliers met over 2 weeks)
- Recommendation on sourcing strategies (Tiering process)
- Contract management (69% -> 84% coverage)
- Cost savings (3.41%) / avoidance (1.18%)

Out of scope:
- Creation of templates (standardization process)
- Improvement of existing tools (scorecard/evaluation matrix)
- Recommendations and "lessons learned"

Skills: communication, interpersonal and facilitation skills, negotiation, analytical skills, synthetical mindset, stress management, stakeholders management
profile_positions.title: SOURCING MANAGER - Resourcing (Mission assigned by Altran)

profile_positions.description:
My responsibilities:

• Support my clients through all Procurement relevant phases, from concept to implementation
• Use my technical skills and field experiences to bridge the gap between strategy and operations
• Develop and deliver innovative solutions for my clients
• Share knowledge and expertise within multidisciplinary teams
• Further develop my expertise in Procurement and/or Project Management if required
• Position myself as an advisor and put my business & communication skills to use

COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS COMMITMENT:
- Consultancy and Technical Support: Providing technical support and subject matter expertise on a time and materials basis to assist my client with its projects.

FIXED PRICE COMMITMENT:
- Projects: Ensure timely production of all deliverables and successful achievement of milestones, within the pre-defined scope and agreed price.
- Outsourced services: Fixed price package (per activity or per recurrent work-package)
profile_positions.title: PURCHASING CONSULTANT - Solution Center

profile_positions.description:
*Consultant - Project assigned by ALTRAN Belgium*

On the Indirect Materials categories in my portfolio for the assigned plant or plants, my tasks were:

•	Participate in developing Sourcing targets for the assigned categories 
•	Participate to the deployment best practices in category sourcing
•	Drive my assigned categories
•	Follow and guarantee the best achievements of cost, quality and service targets of the suppliers
•	Participate to the suppliers’ evaluation and selection, through the nomination committee process, and risk management
•	Drive and follow up all productivity subjects in order to achieve AOP targets
•	Identify and report potential risk in savings forecasts in a timely manner to allow gap closure plans to be implemented
•	Identify savings or innovation opportunities that benefit the company (not necessarily limited to the plant or the region)
•	Deploy the best sourcing strategy in cooperation with the Integrated Supply Chain Manager. 
•	Guarantee the deployment of supply agreements with the suppliers
•	Openly report the achievements and potential opportunities of my categories to my manager 
•	Get from the suppliers the best innovation ideas
•	Analyse supplier markets
•	Negotiate with the suppliers
•	Drive Make or Buy studies
•	Practice Kaizen (Continuous Improvement): e.g. challenge internal processes and procedures where inefficiency is created; question the status quo when colleagues block progress
profile_positions.title: REGIONAL CATEGORY BUYER - Indirect Materials (Mission assigned by Altran)

profile_positions.description:
Mission:
- Manage low- to mid-risk board suppliers
- Drive and lead projects
- Manage internal (global) stakeholder relationships
- Master the analysis of portfolio and market to be the expert of knowledge for the category.

Context: EUR 37M Spend, c.a. >2,500 specifications in the portfolio, over 35 suppliers worldwide with 10% of volume annual growth.

Responsabilities:

Main focus on: Security of Supply, Booster (2012: 7,5% purchasing gains done with Purchasing Methods and Reformulation), MRM (2012: 87,5% of visibility on 100% of Spend), Nature (2012: Stretched the target of 4,2k tons of CO2 reduction), Innovation (projects launch on the market in Q1 2013)

• Manage: Security issues, Productivity Projects, Contracting and Administration, Working Capital, Continuous Improvement and Co2 reduction.
• Support the preparation of the category budget and manage risks and opportunities (Market Risk Management)
• Analyse market and cost data as input for Sourcing Strategies, tenders and benchmarking for the category
• Supplier Relationship Management: maintain and develop relationships with local suppliers and buyers to support global supply development. Performance evaluation and feedback
Innovation: represent the category in appointed innovation projects
• Cooperate in cross-functional and cross-divisional improvement projects
• Support Team: coordinate workload with other team members, behave like a team player, pro-actively support team members.
• Develop Business: pro-actively support stakeholders and contribute in area’s like safety, growth, cost reduction, quality improvement, working capital reduction, etc.
• Implement and roll out SSD procedures, processes and systems
• Contract administration: manage and negotiate the input data for supplier contracts in JDE system as appropriate
• Act as “rapid response” for key issues
• Drive and accelerate implementation of productivity projects in the Supply Points’s by challenging and influencing stakeholders
profile_positions.title: GLOBAL SSD BUYER PACKAGING - Compact Board / EARLY LIFE NUTRITION

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for the French Market, Rotterdam (The Netherlands)

I was responsible for buying french recovered paper (14% of the European Market) we exported to China for recycling, and for all regarding the french market (claims, invoicing, logistics issues).
My job made me frequently travel to France to take care of the existing suppliers panel, and do sourcing with the aim to develop business and increase the ML market shares. 

Mission:
- Buy recovered materials under management instructions and according to the case specific monthly purchasing strategy (generally 20-30k tons of paper)
- Keep regular contact with all suppliers and building a strong commercial relationship in so doing
- Visit suppliers to inspect the material, document and judge their woking method, verify investments made and gather an understanding in regards to their growth potential and market share
- Share market information with the office at all times
- Negotiate claim settlements
- Inform the logistics team regarding supplier and Mark Lyndon needs in terms of freight option
- Be fully aware of competitors in the market and track their movements
- Iron out any issues/disputes in the most commercially viable and diplomatic way possible
- Continuously increase the company's market share whenever possible
- Back-up the other markets to cover for colleagues
- Work very closely with the logistics team in order to insure a smooth transition from the purchase to the vessel loading of the material
- Attend events and trade shows: Pollutec (Paris), European Paper Recycling Conference (2011, Barcelona)

Skills: autonomous, good communicator, influencing skills, commercial skills, curious and eager to learn, technical skills, negotiation skills.
profile_positions.title: MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE - Packaging Buyer
